185912782.review:
MIXED REVIEW if I could so:

Never seen a harder case of "monochrome/Black-white" game.

Every overwhelmingly possitive aspect of this game has a equally gaping flaw counterweight, making the game inconsistent and feel like a chore to play, sacrificing itself for a longer playthrough and forcefully fitted mechanics that will make you wonder if the whole Kojima/Konami drama surrounding this game's release was due to the inconsistencies and unfineshed characteristic of the game.

Even if the story is kind of a fragmented mess its still a Kojima story, set after the greedy release of Ground Zeroes, Snake awakes from a 9 year coma in a Cyprus Hospital where he was hidden from the Cipher organisation who 9 years earlier destroyed his base. Snakes missions from now on will have a dual purpose, discover Ciphers plans and build back the Diamond Dogs Organisation and its funds.  

This enticing story is brought down by a fragmented and unfinished walkthrough where every couple missions you are requiered to take the Helicopter and go to mother base so Ocelot or Miller can explain a worthless online mechanic that Konami wants you to play, honestly i think you can expect to spend hours on dead time traversing a fake open world or in the loading screens of a Helicopter, specially brutal when the game was so much filler and feels overstreched, even if we do not take into account a second unfinished chapter that requieres you to do 3 repeat missions to advance 1 main mission and therefore streching 8 missions into 32; beats me why they decided it was better to leave this on and hide the lore and mainstory behind cassete tapes optional to listen to.

Music choice is masterfull and in-game mechanics are a peak for the time it was released , but the way this mechanics are implemented on repetitive missions where you can exploit 1 or 2 main mechanics like bullet time or sleeper guns forces the player to set arbitrary restrictions on itself to maintain the game fresh till the end.

Needed some more work and someone to restrain the greediness.

185906228.review: El juego tiene 50 misiones principales de las cuales 18 son repetidas pero con mayor dificultad, pero no únicamente las misiones sino la historia, te vuelven a poner las mismas cinemáticas y ahora sin orden alguno (es la primera vez que veo eso en un juego AAA), las misiones secundarias también son repetidas. La jugabilidad es buena. Agarren el juego solo en descuento y si tienen paciencia de hacer misiones repetidas por 40 horas mínimo, o terminar el primer capitulo (30 misiones) y ver el final de la historia y Quiet por youtube.

185857244.review:
Игра пройдена на 100% достижений, и это полный INVISIBLE!

[h1] Геймплей (6/10) [/h1]
Если целью было бы простое прохождение игры, то геймплей можно оценить и выше, но если выполнять все миссии на S ранг со всеми дополнительными задачами, это ужасно. Больше всего раздражали различные баги, которые связаны с поведением НПС: 
- в миссиях, где надо прослушать все диалоги, в один момент НПС могут встать на месте и просто молчать пару игровых часов, а потом разойтись, так ничего и не сказав друг другу;
- различные софтлоки, к примеру, в миссиях, где цель прилетает на вертолете, может получиться так, что вертолет прилетит, а цель из него выходить не будет или же, где по условию задания, в конце миссии надо эвакуировать [u] три [/u] танка, но появляется только [u] два [/u] ;
- враги подрываются на собственных минах, а если трупы найдут их же товарищи, то поднимется тревога.

Все бы ничего если бы, во второй половине игры, не надо было проходить, еще раз часть ТЕХ ЖЕ ПРОШЛЫХ МИССИЙ, но с ПОВЫШЕННОЙ СЛОЖНОСТЬЮ, это портит полностью впечатление от игры под ее конец.

Также в игре, много лишнего и ненужного, я всю игру пробегал с одним и тем же автоматом и с одной и той же винтовкой, изредка меняя винтовку на ракетницу. У меня ни разу не появилась такая игровая ситуация, где мне понадобилось использовать дробовик, пулемет, гранатомет или щит. Та же история с напарниками, способность пса - отмечать врагов в радиусе 100 метров, полностью перекрывает необходимость использовать других напарников. 

Или же вот, дикие животные - вроде хорошая идея, чтобы окружающий мир был более живым, но такое чувство что эту задумку бросили на пол пути и так добавили в игру, потому что части животных в игровом мире вообще нет. И таких довольно крупных особей, как каракал, медоед, лисица и т.д., надо ловить через специальную ловушку, которая размером со ступу Снейка. Почему я должен ловить лису, которой в открытом мире даже не существует, в маленькую клетку, хотя я спокойно могу найти на локации мышь или ежа? Почему бы не добавить одну лису на весь Афганистан и ходи ее и ищи, так было бы намного интереснее, чем сейчас есть в игре.

Спасибо за существование пулемета на вертолете, которым я ни разу не воспользовался, кроме одной миссии, где надо было сюжетно пострелять по-местному евангелиону, но зато в каждый второй миссии об этот пулемет зацепляешься, при попытке спрыгнуть с вертолета, и надо подождать проигрывание анимации доставания и сворачивание этого пулемета.

[h1] Сюжет (10/10) [/h1]
За историей интересно следить, интересно слушать аудиокассеты, а главные и второстепенные герои чувствуются живыми и настоящими. Серьезность игры, в моментах разбавляется японским юмором, в хорошем смысле.

[h1] Графика/анимации и музыка (9/10) [/h1]
Вопросов к графике и анимации - нет, даже сейчас все смотрится довольно красиво и свежо. Что нельзя сказать про музыку, за 120 часов игры, я не могу вспомнить ни один саундтрек, что он есть, что его нет, слух не режет и на том хорошо.

[h1] Заключение [/h1]
Всем советую поиграть в эту замечательную игру. Цена полностью соответствует, тому наслаждению и досугу, что вы получите при прохождении, а если еще и по скидке, то тем более.

185749283.review:
Spoilers.

I wanted to love this game but it's clearly unfinished, both story and gameplay, to start with the good things: The overall gameplay is the best in the series HOWEVER it's not as detailed and interesting like MGS3 for example where you could individually destroy the enemy's communication devices by shooting the radios on their chest. It only has the best character control and it's easy to use, as well as the box but that's all. For some reason, in multiple instances, Snake cannot jump over a waist high wall/rock or even a knee high wall/rock, it's giving GTA 5 restrictions where the game wants you to follow a strict path and throw out every variety you thought you had, for example, i couldn't walk over a hill for some reason despite the fact that it looked perfectly like every other small hill in the game and it pushed me to walk into the Skull Unit which killed Miller and ended with me failing the mission (it was the first mission btw) Snake suffers from leg pain apparently.

The story is a complete mess that constantly lies to you and you never know what is going on, this is in fact a thing that i like about Metal Gear but V does it horribly, if you don't have at least 2 hours to throw away by sitting in a helicopter and listening to tapes (that you have to unlock btw) you will get about 10% of the story which is CRIMINAL, you already have long cutscenes that slowly play out, might as well put dialogue, Koji ended MGS4 with a 72 minute cutscene come on. Koji also gave the boot to David Hayter who is infamous as the English voice of Snake, only to replace him with Kiefer Sunderland that has awful voice acting skills, no range and he also messed up his fist line in Ground Zeroes, his first ever line at the start of the game, and why did he do that? Only because Kiefer Sunderland works at Hollywood, not because he's good at his job. Kojima will dig his grave this way since he doesn't like talent, he likes hollywood and that perfectly reflects Death Stranding and the awful characters.

It only has like 15 missions that actively progress the story in a game which has 50 missions and even those 50 missions aren't even new ones, past one point you are given the exact same mission but with a modifier like Total Stealth or Extreme and the repetitive nature grinds your gears, pun intended.

The characters aren't that interesting, Miller and Ocelot appear once a full moon and only to spit lies and the truth you get, once again, in tapes. Skull Face was by far the most interesting of all, his idea of global deterrence where he has the control resonated with me for some reason, it's like putting the boot into the mouths of countries that see you as cannon fodder and exploit you dry, forcing them to lick the "power" that Skull Face gives them, while in reality that power doesn't exist and if you try to use it, He pulls the plug and you're worthless, meanwhile, giving the suppressed countries the power to stand up to the suppressors, or the illusion of power, total deterrence. Tretij Rebenok and Man on Fire were by far the most intriguing of all, both of them never spoke and and had mind numbing power and presentation and who their identities made you gasp if you played MGS1 and 3. Quiet is by far the worst character, never speaks even though she can? Cannot speak english because of the parasites but what made you unable to speak German? French? Russian? Hell Ocelot knows Russian since it's his mother tongue, go on girl god damn, cannot write either? sign language? Oh you know Navajo? Come on then, speak, Code Talker can translate but nooooo, you need Snake to be dying for you to open your mouth and even then, the parasites are harmless...YOU HAVE NO LUNGS, GIRL COME ON, Koji really went above and beyond to make her mute for the dumbest of reasons, then completely forget about the alternatives and guess what? It never worked in the first place, this dude made an essay on why and how, it is completely necessary for the plot to have Quiet wearing a Bikini and show her assets in the most unnecessary ways possible. Don't get me wrong, i like boba just like the next guy but don't shove it in my face every 2 seconds when i'm managing the Mother base staff (which is crucial to the continuation of the story).

The open world is big and empty, most of it is unused and the outposts lack the complexity of the old games, Groznij Grad was full of cameras, personnel, guard dogs, you name it while OKB Zero (the biggest base in the game) is small and has 3 cameras total, the only + that V has is the power generators 

The game tries to be mysterious and deep but ends up being time consuming, shallow and dumb. And it doesn't help that most of the fandom buy that Kojima said it's finished as intended, he only said that to not antagonize his relationship with Konami which was falling apart quicker than Chinese buildings, and also because he couldn't "hate" on the game when the company wanted money out of it since they barely released it at that time.

185658451.review:
It's really good, but . . . if you know, you know
games amazing but not finished, lots of questions left unanswered, some stuff rushed some stuff dragged out too long. Overall though while the story is left behind in some aspects, it's still up there in it's odd state. It's all lifted up by the music that's also, pretty good. What is definitely lacking though is just the environment. If you've played ground zeroes then you should know that ground zeroes is probably the best map in metal gear solid v and outside of that it's going through empty african fields with a few huts and a lot of soldiers. Mgsv does try to alleviate this with a couple more areas and bases that are rather unique and interesting to approach, but honestly as uninteresting as the environments are, the gameplay never suffers.

Gameplay is in fact mgsv's strongest aspect. There is roughly no game that has done what this game does for stealth combat. Trust me when I say I have looked. Tom clancy's wildlands and breakpoint, while trying a lot of the same stuff, loses just as much that is special in order to simplify it into a 7/10 third person shooter first and a stealth game second. Tools or dynamic methods of approach all are kept to a minimum. I would give the sniper elite franchise a close second for having a rather close formula that is comparable to mgsv, however sniper elite is still focused around shooting first, enemies, the environment and dynamic methods of approach second. 

What metal gear brings to the table that's so special that isn't done by really any game is everything around the shooting if you couldn't tell. Enemies have unique behaviors that are necessary for having a good stealth game, but also not the focus, just serviceable enough to pass and not bad enough to be a detriment. However the methods of interaction you can have with them can be shooting a sleep dart while they're looking over the edge of a lookout post to make them fall over, which if anyone's underneath can knock them out too. You can distract them with boxes that trick them into thinking it's their commander or a lovely person on initial glance to get by or maybe even capture them, just a few fun things like that without mentioning that there's an interrogation system that is both simple but adds a lot to making the game what it is. 
Outside of the npc's you have plenty of ways to go through areas, you can climb up walls, or shimmy up crevices, you can ride a horse through the middle of their base and just lay against the horse's side to hide. Maybe if you want you can send that same horse out to a blocked pathway and distract them all by making the horse defecate on command. You can airdrop in any vehicle you've captured or call in a bomb strike. 

It can be difficult to say exactly why this is all special added together, but a good example of a situation is how you can throw a smoke grenade into the back of a jeep before driving it out into the middle of an area and diving out the side and rolling into some tall grass as the smoke spreads throughout the area. Then while everyone's blinded you can call your dog to jump up and slit the throats of everyone there without being seen. It's the open endedness that while ordinarily would make an open sandbox game that would demand for you to make up the fun as you go such as in breath of the wild, kenshi or minecraft, this is instead offering enough direction to not ever make you question what you're doing, something I'd later appreciate about helldivers 2, or why certain tools are available as it's all part of the mission and everything has a situation where it would be the most optimal thing to use making this guided, but also an open sandbox except the need or want to experiment is instead offered up as more of a demand unlike most sandbox games which all of this is to say the game is something special.

I think the only missed aspect about this game would unfortunately be 2 things, the missions and mother base.

my problem with the missions are the same with the story, after roughly 15 missions or so the game stops telling a story and roughly just keeps offering challenges, nothing interesting or unique just another thing to go try. This isn't bad and I really did enjoy them, but when it gets bad is when it picks back up in the story only to have 12 final missions before you get to see the ending and the final missions are all quite literally, the same missions done earlier in the game just with modifiers. I love the modifier idea for missions, I just wish that instead they were settings you could enable or disable for each mission instead of the game saying it's a whole new mission especially since it gatekeeps the ending.

Now about mother base...
This game has a whole system around capturing soldiers to "recruit them" which builds up stats in your base to unlock crafting recipes. This is how it paces out the tools given to you so you're not too overwhelmed by your options but still making you excited for what you can use next. Unfortunately it's not done very well. You'll often need tons and tons of resources to go with these recruits or even resources to pick up more recruits which is done by doing the jankiest collectathon system of all time in game. You look for sparkly spots on the ground that show diamonds and give you the in game currency. Or you can pick up small boxes for fuel or something. If it was just capturing enemies it would be one thing, but the whole system is bottlenecked by resources and later they try to get really ambitious with the system for certain story sequences that require you to know a lot about your members. Don't get me wrong it's all still cool, but it's clear that there was a lot more that wanted to be done here and this is all they could do. 

All of this being said though, having an extra encouragement to spot enemies is appreciated and really cool. Just beyond that main point it's pretty rough.

Please try this game, it get's pretty cheap and even though they don't drop the price as much since the mgs collection came out, the game is well worth 30$ and it also pretty much runs on anything while still looking amazing. It's all absolutely worth your time.

185568617.review:
Juegardopolis. Cabe señalar que no he jugado ningún otro MG ni soy especialmente fan de la saga, aunque sí que hepasado más horas de las que me gustaría admitir leyendo la wiki.

No he escuchado mucho análisis a cerca de como este juego trata la cuestión del lenguaje. No sólo la trama esta pepina si no que también ahonda en cuestiones bastante interesantes como pueden ser el imperialismo o el internacionalismo. Lo que más me ha llamado la atención es lo comprometido que está con su análisis de como el lenguaje moldea la forma en la que pensamos y traduce lo que percibimos del mundo exterior en base a unos patrones que no hemos elegido. Al fin y al cabo quien controla el lenguaje controla las ideas y una idea manifestada en un lenguaje deja de ser una idea y empieza a ser una "mentira".

Por otra parte la similitudes entre el Ches Guevara y BB son claras, no solo en GZ se hace referencia explícita a esto, si no que en varias ocasiones se especifica como una leyenda puede ser construida a espensas de un hombre y su causa antiimperialista.
Es cierto también que peca de una hipersexualización de Quiet de manera obscena y de mal gusto, a lo mejor a los que os gusta haceros pajas con polígonos os molesta esta alegación, pero os animaría encarecidamente a conocer a mujeres de carne y hueso más allá de vuestra madre o vuestra abuela.

En cuanto a la dirección, a mi el estilo exagerado y cinematográfico de Kojima me gusta aunque no tengo rubor en reconocer que en contadas ocasiones ridiculiza la escena y hace que no te la tomes tan en serio como deberías. Esto no arruina la experiencia y la realidad es que el juego tiene escenas muy épicas y secuencias, como la de la propagación del virus por la unidad médica, que son magistrales.
 
En cuanto a la jugabilidad que decir, es increíble. El único juego que yo creo que se le acerca en el realismo del movimiento es Death stranding, que también es de Kojima. Tienes todo tipo de posturas y el personaje se adapta al entorno e interactúa con el mediante unas animaciones directamente avanzadas para su época y para hoy en día.
Las misiones y el sigilo están muy pulidas en la primera parte del juego y ofrece muchas formas de resolverlas y un montón de cosas que pueden interactuar entre sí para salir del paso mediante la improvisación, personalmente no he probado a jugarlo de otra forma que no sea el sigilo extremo.
Una cosa que no me ha gustado nada es la repetitividad de escenarios. No como tal, si no de sitios muy parecidos. Ojalá hubiera habido alguna misión de infiltración en interiores porque practicamente no hay ninguna en todo el juego. Es por esto que las mecánicas a veces se sienten desaprovechadas por los escenarios. 
En cuanto a los escenarios me hacía falta un tercer escenario como el agua, tal vez uno urbano, hablaremos de esto más adelante pero se nota que el juego está sin terminar en cosas como esta.

En general es un juego al que le eché +60h y no me aburrí ni un solo momento. Esto tiene que ver entre otras cosas en cómo el juego maneja la dificultad. Como tal, la dificultad es fija, pero cuentas con tantas formas de hacer las misiones y tantos utensilios y ayudas que usar que puedes adaptar tu equipo para hacer la misión en modo "fácil" sin perder la experiencia ni realmente cambiar la ia de los enemigos por ejemplo.

Por último queda hablar de lo desgraciadamente más importante. el juego está sin terminar. No en cuanta a bugs ni fallos técnicos que no he tenido literalmente ninguno, si no en cuanto a contenido. Una vez llegas al 65% del juego la mayoría de las misiones son repetidas pero más difíciles, incluso las cinemáticas son iguales. La otra mitad se siente en su mayoría nueva pero no sirve para profundizar lo suficiente en la historia y lograr que no se sienta apresurada. Los problemas personales y técnicos sufridos durante el desarrollo hicieron mella en el juego de una forma ineludible, siendo para mi la segunda mitad del juego en parte una decepción.

Visto esto el MGSV:PP me parece ÉL juego de sigilo y en general una obra que roza el estatus de maestra, pero se ve limitada por cuestiones extravideojueguiles. A mi personalemte me encató y me dejó un vacío muy dificil de llenar en cuanto a jugabilidad e historia.

185416776.review:
A gold standard of gaming that is largely unmatched today. Moving around and playing as Snake just *feels* good. All the movement options with detailed animations (rolling, dolphin diving, even crawling on your back) give you a ton of control over how you move through space while always feeling responsive and precise. It gives you so many fun toys to play with, too—decoys, C4, sleep grenades, remote strikes, companions. You can throw a grenade and have Quiet shoot it midair to blow up a helicopter hovering overhead. This is a game that *wants* you to explore and exploit its mechanics, and Kojima has thought of everything.

So much of this game is done to benefit immersion, and it’s something very few other games even attempt. Every menu in-game is actually Snake himself looking at a menu — it’s minor, but jarring when you go to play a different game and the menu is just a bunch of graphics that takes you out of the gameplay. Call in supplies or weapons and watch them descend on a parachute from the sky like they were just airdropped in. This game world feels *real* in a way other games don’t. 

Multiplayer is interesting and a bit of a mixed bag. FOB missions are a creative take on Dark Souls invasions that allows for both synchronous PVP and asynchronous PVE multiplayer, though these days it’s rare you’ll actually have an invasion/defense occur. I find FOB missions fun but repetitive, with a skill floor that goes up very quickly once you start getting to higher tier FOBs. Seriously, go check out high level FOB gameplay on YouTube, you need some *serious* skill to even think about infiltrating a 4/4 FOB with S+ staff and security devices. If you like skill-based grindfests you might dig it. I find it captivating for a bit every now and then, but eventually it grows stale.

Everyone complains about the story and, yeah, compared to the other Metal Gear games this one is weaker and more subtle with its storytelling. However, it still has a better story than 99% of games. It’s a different style of storytelling than other MGS games as Kojima was experimenting with narrative for an open world game. How well it succeeds is up for debate, but in any case what’s here is much more complex and interesting than most AAA games.

And the graphics still look phenomenal. That this game was able to run at all on PS3/360 is incredible. Running through the jungle blasting Maneater is an unmatched gaming vibe.

''Ben daha önceden meğerse 'Sneak' mekanikli bir oynamamışım. Detaylara aşağıda değineceğim, ama Kojima-san döktürmüş gene. Vur-kır-geç arıyorsan bu oyunu geç, ama gizlilik yaparım dersen, mutlaka dene.''

Temel Değerlendirme : 
HİKAYE : Açıkçası kurgusu mükemmel, önceki oyunlarla kurduğu bağlantı falan beynimi patlattı. Hikaye güzel, ama sunumu rezalet. 7/10

GRAFİK : Güzel. 7/10

DETAYLAR : Ya işte, bak Kojima-san, Kojima-san diyorum ya. Adam burada büyüsünü konuşturmuş. Mesela osurdun, düşman telsizle bilgi geçiyor: 'Merkez, biri osurdu araştırıyorum.'. Bunu derken yapışırsan boğazına, lafı kesildiği için merkez herkesi alarma geçiriyor, bu adama bir şey oldu gidin bakın diyerek. 10/10

HATALAR: Görev sunumu. 2. kısımdan sonra görevlerin birkaçı tekrar ediyor.

Sonuç:
 Dediğim gibi, ben daha önce sneak oyun oynamamışım: Eğer sneak oyun böyle bir şey ise. Başlarda çok sinirlenmiştim. Sonradan geliştikçe alıştım.
 
 Ve her göreve başladığında film izliyorsun sanki, isimler geliyor. Tamam Hideo'cuğum, sen yaptın bu oyunu. Zaten sana Kojima-san çekiyorum. Da birader sal beni de, oyunu oynayayim. Oyunu açıyorum 'Produced by Hideo Kojima', göreve giriyorum 'Produced by Hideo Kojima', görev bitiyor 'Produced by Hideo Kojima', oyunu kapatıyorum 'Produced by Hideo Kojima'. Lan tamam en producer sensin kojima.
 
 Ama oynanış mekanikleri, detaylar muazzam. Vur-kır oyunu değil dedim, ama istersen ona da yönelebilirsin. Oyunun sana verdiği imkanlar çok fazla. Bir adamı birden fazla etkisiz hale getirme yolun var. Başta biraz zorluyor, ama alışınca hastası oluyorsun. 

 Eski oyunlar ile olan bağları da çok kuvvetli. İLK oynadığım MGS bu, fakat gerek miimler ile, gerek biraz da seri genel kültür olduğu için az-biraz bilgiliydim karakterler ile ilgili. Serinin kurgusuna, karakter olay örgüsüne hayran kaldım. Bu 'Snake Aile Ağacı' diyebileceğim olay örgüsünü de öğrendiğim gibi heyecan basmaya başladı, diğer oyunları da oynamayı istememe sebep oldu.

185248671.review:
Simply the best stealth action military shooter out there. One of the most sophisticated enemy AI designs that makes for an excellent sandbox design. They adapt to the playstyle the player employs. Use guns and they wear body armor, only do headshots and they wear helmets, play most missions during the night and they come equipped with night vision goggles and flashlights, sneak a base through unconventional paths the enemies will set up mine fields there, etc. The gun play is also extremely satisfying, each and every weapon have a good punch to them. Guns also have bullet drop distance like in MilSims. Game also offers first person shooting for better accuracy. Both maps are faithful recreations of the countries they are based on, though of course every locale in the game is fictional.

I like the vast array of options available to the player for both pacifist style and lethal style gameplay. Very few games do this.

Base building is a cool feature. You create your own army and they help you develop better weapons and gear. It is a missed opportunity though that you can't call on your army in the open world. it'll just be you, your companion (D-Dog, D-Horse, or Quiet) and Pequod.

The game has a good selection of soundtracks ranging from MGS originals to licensed songs from the 80s. Oh and Invisible by Duran Duran is most definitely part of the OST collection, always was and always will be.

The story is great but it is clearly incomplete. Though this is the first Metal Gear game I've played, I could still see the apparent lack of story content like how the ending just sort of happens. Though the audio cassette tapes reveal a lot of details its not enough. The lack of story is more obvious when I got to know more about MGS lore. This game answers plenty but again not everything. Though I'll admit I'm satisfied with how the game is because of how brilliant the gameplay is despite the lack in story. I wish Venom Snake talked more though, Kiefer Sutherland did a terrific job voicing him.

Graphically the game holds up well even by today's standards. The character models are highly detailed. The FOX engine is probably the most efficient and resource light game engine I've ever seen. The game can run well on weak hardware too. Its a shame that it only got used in a few titles and abandoned. Could've developed into something even more.

Haven't played the multiplayer much since it's mostly dead now. Has many gamemodes, played TDM once some years ago and it felt like an average CoD TDM but in third person. Seen videos of FoB base raids (where you infiltrate other player's military bases) and that seemed really fun but it's a shame I didn't get to experience it myself.

I'd recommend this game to anyone, its a masterpiece even with the flaws in storytelling. One of the few games that I can keep playing again and again. 10/10 in every-way.

185185130.review:
I finished the story mode after 386 hours and so the world feels empty when I return to FOB.

Unfortunately we all reach this point but its bittersweet.

After 3 restarts and 7 years since the start on my old laptop, I could never finish the game properly (may that be due to switching places or switching devices constantly). When I first got the game I did it due to excitement on discovering my second Metal Gear game (first one was MGR) and I can say confidently as a guy who absolutely LOVES STEALTH this is the best stealth shooter you will ever find. Period.

Constant discoveries and switching of hardware and fanaticism about stealth kept bringing me back to this game. A final Big Boss game and discovery of an ending that loops the Metal Gear back. I strongly incline to play this game even if you don't want to spoil the series, due to how fun and really forward it is in gameplay (compared to even modern games!).

The graphics are insane. The sound design is crisp. The dialogue is intriguing. The environment is impactful. The relationship with the world is....unforgettable. The character building of Snake and how you play him really shows your connection of how you see the Big Boss of this series.

Multiplayer FOB raids which was not included before in MGS series is an amazing idea, showing another "end-game" way of going way and beyond the simple stealth game. Building your own army, raiding others, growing stronger and FEELING the progression is truly shows that Hideo and his subordinates are masters at work.

If I go into how detailed this game is then this review would be unreadable to be honest, but you can trust me. The more you play this game the more you will realise how everything just works. Everything is catered so that you can utilise everything at your disposal. Everything has impact, depending on your usage of gadgets and it's not like RPG of course but you really can feel the environment adopting to you.

Switching Codecs to Audio Logs was a really smart idea I believe. Yes it removes some suspense but I think it still holds up. Being able to play them anywhere, whatever and whenever is a really good idea. The audio logs really give you an idea on the world and with how good the voice acting is (also the transcript) makes you want to continue to listen to them again and again.

Cut-scenes really make my day. It's rare compared to other MGS but damn do they feel good. I can't believe I discovered more of random ones when somebody for first time attacked my FOB (I tried FOB invasion only this year due to being a coward lol) and I can say I am always impressed by an insane "camera work" (which really ups the immersion and storytelling). Completing the game makes me realise I won't be able to discover some new ones and maybe that's why I am thinking of slowly giving up on doing 100% knowing that there's really nothing special about it (for me at least).

Would I recommend this game?
Absolutely, Metal Gear Solid is a must play series for anyone who plays games. The game introduces amazing characters with plenty of personality. An introduction of amazing story which is not always go-happy, but very thought provoking. And, of course, amazing gameplay (which might of course be confusing in other MGS, but in here it feels natural and even intriguing).

Please do not pass this game, even-through its owned by KONAMI. You would be really making it a disservice. Regardless of how "unfinished" it is I would say it's more then enough to feel like a completed story.

What else I can say. 386 hours and hopefully more. I can't wait for a day where I will play other Metal Gear Solid titles (playing Portable Ops on PSP now). I watched all of playthroughs but I am sure I will experience it fresh and I will enjoy my brain tingling from how dope this over-analysed (and in good sense) game plays.

185030780.review:
MGSV:TPP is a top-notch stealth experience. While the prologue takes its sweet time introducing you to basic mechanics, afterward the game quickly leans into its strong suit - field operations. Each mission assigned to you can be approached from many sides and in many ways. It is certainly possible to go in guns blazing, but if you choose the stealthy approach and succeed, you will be rewarded with both in-game prizes and greater real-life satisfaction. 

The stealth mechanic itself is very well-polished. Enemies react reasonably. Sight ranges and sound dispersal mechanics feel intuitive and fair. The tools in your arsenal are many and varied, so if you get bored of doing chokeholds, you can absolutely switch things up.  As a keyboard+mouse player, I’d appreciate more buttons for various actions, but the game is far from unplayable, even if some controls are a bit janky. 

Fans of the MGS franchise probably also care about the game’s plot. However, as a newcomer into this universe, I found the story rather opaque in part due to the, frankly, perplexing method of delivery (cassette tapes to reveal important information and the weirdly unnatural dialogue). Not to mention that the lore as a whole is a bit… unconventional. Add to this that MGSV’s high degree of “gamification” is not very conducive to storytelling, and you have a recipe for a story that is a brick wall for those without prior knowledge. It is a really good thing, then, that MGS:V makes it easy to focus on its gameplay elements. Or a bad thing, I guess, if you are a lore-buff. 

MGS:V shines brightest in its early and middle stages. Story-wise because the game’s 2nd chapter is unfinished, which is not just my opinion, but a well-known fact among the community. And gameplay-wise, because the initial relatively-low-tech environment forces you into a game of patience where timing is everything. Since late-game upgrades give you access to abilities which are pretty much superhuman, the emotional payoff for any successful takedown is proportionally smaller. Eventually, you can become a one-man army, and rising enemy difficulty levels and counts cannot quite keep up. 

Thankfully, MGSV features a truly silly amount of challenges, many of which give you the incentive to take the minimalist route. Clearing missions isn’t particularly hard. Clearing missions while leaving no traces of your existence is very much so. The game leaves it up to you to choose wherein your goals lie, a design decision that other titles shouldn’t be afraid of adopting. 

Freedom of tactical approach and the freedom to define your own goals combine with near-impeccable stealth mechanics and a spectacular variety of possible operations to make MGSV truly a titan in its genre. 

The best I-was-never-here simulator out there. 8/10.

184835920.review:
OKAY, i've spent 94.3 hours playing this game and here's is my review...

This game is something else. It’s totally different from any third-person shooter I’ve played before. The gameplay is so unique and fresh, with features you just don’t see in other games. What’s cool is that you can play it however you want—you’re not stuck following the story or the mission structure like in other rigid third-person shooter.

You can go full stealth mode like a ninja or go in guns blazing like Rambo—it’s your call. Features like the Fulton Recovery System (where you can "abduct" enemies), the Buddy System with partners like D-Dog or Quiet, and managing your Mother Base all make the game feel so rich and full of possibilities.

BUT... The story feels unfinished. Honestly, if Konami had given Kojima Sensei another year or two to finish the game, it could’ve been perfect. Even so, the story is still engaging enough, especially if you’re a die-hard Metal Gear fan.

even so, as someone who has played MGS 4 and Snake Eater, the shift to an open-world setting threw me off a bit at first. But once I got used to it, I realized it’s actually a great change. It gives you so much more freedom to explore and experiment, and for the Metal Gear series, it feels like a breath of fresh air.

What makes this game extra special is that it’s the last Metal Gear game created by Kojima Sensei. Maybe that’s why he went all out and poured every crazy, brilliant idea he had into it.

So, would I recommend it?
Absolutely!
If you’re into open-world games that give you a ton of freedom (without being overwhelming), or if you just love creative and unique gameplay, this game is a must-play. For a Metal Gear Solid game, this one’s up there with the best—even with its flaws.

184655152.review:
[quote=-Gray Fox, Metal Gear Solid]"We're not tools of the government or anyone else. Fighting was the only thing... the only thing I was good at, but... At least I always fought for what I believed in."[/quote]

Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain stands as Hideo Kojima's final opus in the legendary franchise, and what a farewell it turned out to be. Like a perfectly orchestrated military operation, every element of this game comes together to create something truly remarkable, even if it leaves us with more questions than answers

[h3]The gameplay is nothing short of revolutionary for the series[/h3] 
Gone are the linear corridors of Shadow Moses, replaced by vast, open landscapes that serve as your tactical space. Every mission becomes a playground with many solutions - whether you're calling in D-Dog for backup, asking Quiet to provide sniper support, or riding into an enemy base on D-Horse while blasting "Take On Me" from iDroid. Yes, the grind for GMP to develop advanced gear can feel tedious, but each new gear in your arsenal opens up fresh approaches to infiltration

[h3]The soundtrack deserves special mention[/h3] 
Beyond the licensed '80s hits like "The Man Who Sold The World" [i](which carries deeper meaning than initially apparent)[/i] and "Friday I'm In Love," the original score perfectly captures both the loneliness of the Afghan desert and the tension of a nighttime infiltration, but in order to find all these bangers you ought to explore the world for these precious cassettes!

[h3]Now, about that story...[/h3]
 The narrative is where things get [i]complicated[/i], in true Metal Gear fashion. The plot itself might seem straightforward compared to previous entries, but there's a fascinating theory worth exploring: What if the 'V' isn't just for "5" or "Venom"?(Is it Peace or Victory)
[b]Possible Spoilers Ahead[/b]: [spoiler]What if we're experiencing another VR simulation, similar to Raiden's training in MGS2? Consider the evidence: The hallucinations, the peace symbol callbacks to Peace Walker, the fragmented nature of the missions, and most importantly, the themes of phantom pain and manufactured reality. Just as MGS2 questioned the [b]nature of digital information and manipulation[/b], MGSV might be questioning the very nature of identity and memory. This would explain some of the game's the surreal whale scene (MobyDick reference?), the frequent hallucinations, and how certain missions repeat with increased difficulty (very VR-like). The way characters appear and disappear, the inconsistencies with established Metal Gear lore, even the game's obsession with "phantom pain" itself - it all points to a deeper layer of reality manipulation that Kojima never explicitly confirms or denies...[/spoiler] This ambiguity seems intentional, leaving players to grapple with questions of reality versus simulation - a theme that's been present since Metal Gear Solid 2. Unfortunately, with Kojima's departure from Konami and Metal Gear Survive's different direction, we may never get concrete answers

[quote=-Big Boss, MGS: Peace Walker]"The truth is what you make of it."[/quote]

The game's technical achievements can't be overlooked. The Fox Engine delivers stunning visuals while maintaining smooth performance across platforms. The attention to detail is staggering - from the way sand sticks to wet clothing to the dynamic weather system affecting stealth gameplay, soldiers adapting to tactics and the Cardboard box! The online Forward Operating Base (FOB) missions add another layer of depth, creating a persistent world of espionage and base defense, though they might not be everyone's cup of tea

[i]Is it a perfect game? No. But its [b]imperfections[/b][/i], much like the shrapnel in Big Boss's head, serve as a reminder of what was and what could have been. MGSV represents both the pinnacle of stealth-action gameplay and a bittersweet farewell to one of gaming's most influential series. 
And with the MGS3 remake on the horizon and somewhat recent release of the Master Collection, there's never been a better time to dive into the series. The Phantom Pain might not tie up every loose end in the Metal Gear saga, but it's an incredible stealth-action sandbox that pushes the boundaries of what games can be

184608990.review:
[h1]🕶️ **Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain : Le pion final de Big Boss** 🕶️[/h1]  
[p]Temps de jeu : Suffisant pour reconstruire Diamond Dogs, infiltrer des bases ennemies, et se demander si ce carton mérite un Oscar.[/p]  
[p]Genre : Action-infiltration en monde ouvert avec une dose de chaos tactique et d’émotions.[/p]  
[hr]  
[p]**Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain** est une œuvre magistrale qui mêle gameplay innovant et narration troublante, tout en explorant les cicatrices laissées par la guerre et la vengeance. Vous incarnez Venom Snake (aka Big Boss), le légendaire soldat, dans une quête pour reconstruire son armée et affronter Cipher, tout en naviguant dans un monde où le danger se cache derrière chaque dune de sable et chaque tour de garde.[/p]  
  
[h2]Gameplay et contenu :[/h2]  
[p]🎮 **Un gameplay d'infiltration fluide** : Le jeu vous offre une liberté totale pour accomplir vos objectifs. Infiltrez en mode fantôme ou semez le chaos, à vous de choisir. Mention spéciale pour le carton qui reste l’outil le plus polyvalent du monde vidéoludique.[/p]  
[p]🌍 **Un monde ouvert immersif** : Explorez l’Afghanistan et l’Afrique subsaharienne, remplis de paysages variés, de bases ennemies complexes et de secrets à découvrir.[/p]  
[p]🐶 **Compagnons mémorables** : D-Dog, D-Horse, et Quiet, chacun apporte une dynamique unique au gameplay. D-Dog, en particulier, est le meilleur bon garçon du champ de bataille (et il détecte les mines, ce qui est toujours utile).[/p]  
[p]🛠️ **Gestion de Mother Base** : Construisez votre armée privée, développez des technologies, et recrutez des soldats. L’aspect gestion est addictif et donne un vrai sentiment de progression.[/p]  
[p]🎵 **La bande-son rétro** : Ramassez des cassettes contenant des classiques des années 80. Rien de tel que "Take on Me" pour infiltrer une base ennemie.[/p]  
  
[h2]Les points positifs :[/h2]  
[p]🌟 **Une liberté de gameplay sans précédent** : Chaque mission peut être abordée de mille façons. Le jeu vous récompense pour votre créativité.[/p]  
[p]🔥 **Un mélange d'action et d'émotion** : Les cinématiques et les twists narratifs frappent fort, même si certains laissent des questions ouvertes (coucou, Eli et Sahelanthropus).[/p]  
[p]🎩 **Des références au lore MGS** : Le jeu est truffé de clins d'œil pour les fans de longue date, du cigare Phantom aux enregistrements de Kaz et Ocelot.[/p]  
  
[h2]Les points négatifs :[/h2]  
[p]⏳ **Un acte final abrupt** : La fin laisse un goût d'inachevé, même si elle soulève des débats intéressants parmi les fans.[/p]  
[p]🤔 **Une narration parfois fragmentée** : Les cassettes audios remplacent souvent les scènes cinématiques, ce qui peut décevoir ceux qui préfèrent une narration visuelle.[/p]  
  
[hr]  
[p]🏆 **Le platine ?** Préparez-vous à relever des défis herculéens, comme terminer toutes les missions avec rang S et développer toutes les armes. Comptez 150 heures pour décrocher cet honneur, et encore plus si vous perdez du temps à Fultoniser toutes les chèvres du jeu.[/p]  
  
[p]En résumé, **Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain** est une lettre d’amour à l’infiltration et un adieu complexe au légendaire Big Boss. Que vous soyez un fan inconditionnel de la série ou un nouveau venu, ce jeu offre une expérience inoubliable. Alors, équipez votre carton, mettez vos lunettes de soleil, et préparez-vous à entrer dans la légende. 🕶️🐍[/p]

这是一款游戏性极其丰富、值得玩家反复体验的游戏，其最大的亮点在于高度自由的玩法设计，尤其是在潜入机制上给予了玩家极大的创意空间。游戏允许玩家根据自身的想象力与策略制定独特的行动方案，无论是巧妙利用环境、工具，还是探索不同的解决方法，都能带来截然不同的体验。这种开放式的设计让每一次游玩都充满新鲜感与挑战性，玩家能够不断尝试新思路来达成目标，充分感受到自由度和多样化玩法的乐趣。

此外，游戏中的细节也令人印象深刻，无论是关卡设计、任务设置，还是人物互动，都展现了开发者对游戏机制的深刻打磨。这种细致入微的设计不仅增强了沉浸感，还提升了玩家对游戏世界的探索兴趣。无论是喜欢策略性强的玩家，还是更偏爱自由探索的玩家，都能在游戏中找到乐趣。总之，这款游戏的多样化玩法和开放式潜入体验使其成为值得深入体验和反复游玩的佳作。

184598094.review:
If you are invested in the plot of Metal Gear games this may not be the game for you. The story for this game is incomplete, you will 100% be blue balled if you go all the way to the very end, and even compared to other Metal Gear stories this one doesn't feel as interesting imo. That being said if you aren't that into the stories (I am not, despite appreciating the production of the cutscenes and cinematography Kojima puts into his games) I think this game is definitely worth trying. Much of it hinges upon the sandbox aspect. There is a ton of room for customizing loadouts, choosing where to drop into a map for missions, what direction to infiltrate from, the option to have partners with different strengths, etc. There are many instances where if you think maybe you can do something, there's a good chance you can because of the nuance of your gear in conjuction with the engine and enemy AI.

The tight level design of previous entries isn't quite as present in this entry (though there are still very well designed areas to interact with), and the game can get a little repetitive since all missions take place within the same 2 maps (which are large and have a lot of locales to infiltrate, but still can get repetitive). Despite these short comings the extreme level of player choice and experimentation make this my favorite Metal Gear Solid game, though die hard fans of the series or people who really get invested in the story may feel differently.

184496220.review:
Metal Gear Solid V is an amazing game. The graphics are absolutely amazing especially for a game that is now 9 years old. But MGS V’s greatest strength lies in its game play mechanics. The fusion of open-world design and stealth action offers unparalleled freedom. You are given a variety of interesting and cool tools and strategies when playing missions. 

I also really enjoyed the setting. The Afghanistan and Angola-Zaire border regions are rich with environmental storytelling. Each base, village, and terrain type feels meticulously designed, adding a sense of realism and immersion. 

The game's greatest weakness is probably it's fragmented narrative. The narrative, while intriguing in parts, lacks the cohesion and depth expected of a Metal Gear title. The game's episodic structure and underdeveloped characters dilute the emotional impact. Many fans were left disappointed by unanswered questions and dangling plot threads, particularly concerning the abrupt conclusion of Chapter 2 and the absence of a proper finale. If this game's ending was done properly this would have easily been a 10/10

184360730.review:
Aunque no le dieron el tiempo suficiente a Kojima para poder pulir su último proyecto de Metal Gear con KONAMI, es un juego con muy buenas mecánicas jamás antes vistas. La caza de animales, el sigilo es otra cosa, los escenarios están muy bien diseñados con amor y dedicación. Nada en el mapa se siente vacío y siempre está lleno de vida, con un buen ciclo de tiempo que siempre varía con el comportamiento de los enemigos, animales y clima, aparte de eso hay recolección de cintas de música, archivos, plantas y mucho más. Es algo increíble para un juego de mundo abierto. Las animaciones son increíbles y muy realistas a la hora de neutralizar enemigos, moverse por el mapa y mucho más.

Con respecto a la historia, es muy emocionante y entretenida. Cada uno de los personajes está muy bien desarrollado con su trasfondo, ideales, características y lo que sucedió con ellos en el pasado. Además, el juego nos cuenta todo acerca de ellos tanto en la historia como en casetes. Las cinematicas son increiblemente buenas llenas de movimiento, accion y efectos que resaltan la muy buena calidad de estas. La IA de los enemigos no es muy buena y tiene diferentes fallos, tienden a ser muy torpes y, a la hora de escuchar conversaciones estas se bugean lo que impide completar ciertas tareas de las misiones y es tedioso ya que tienes que volver a repetirlas. Lo mismo ocurre con la mecánica de capturar animales, que es pura suerte, hubiera sido mejor tener un desarrollo más profundo en lugar de depender solo de colocar jaulas y esperar a que por pura suerte tocara el animal que querías para tu colección.

El modo online es algo que fracasó en 2015 y, aunque en 2024 esté abandonado, puede ser útil si eres nuevo y quieres mejorar tus armas, base, etc. En esta época sirve solo para farmear lo que necesites. Además, requiere mucha estrategia de sigilo para infiltrarte en las bases de otros jugadores y conforme avanzas las bases de otors jugadores se vuelven más difíciles de entrar. Solo la gente que es muy tryhard sigue jugando ese modo para ver quién llega al top y tiene la mejor defensa, nadie te va a invadir ya que como dije el modo de juego de POA en pleno 2024 esta muerto, sale que hay gente que tiene bases pero son bases abandonadas por jugadores que compraron y jugaron el juego en 2015, puedes igualmente reforzar tu base por gusto propio y decorarla.

Las misiones, en cierto punto de la historia, se vuelven a repetir con un nivel absurdo de dificultad sin sentido alguno. Esto sucede por que KONAMI ya le habia puesto un presupuesto fijo a Kojima y el al quedarse sin presupuesto tuvo que reciclar misiones volviéndolas más difíciles e imposibles para algunos jugadores, incluso tediosas a la hora de completar las tareas extra que pide la misión apesar que ya hay bugs en las tareas de misiones normales. Ademas que iba a haber una Mision 51 pero KONAMI despidio al equipo de Kojima por que estos ya habian pasado el presupuesto que la empresa les habia dado, por lo que no pudo completar Metal Gear Solid V

Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain es un juego que no está pulido al 100%. Si tan solo KONAMI le hubiera dado el tiempo suficiente al equipo de Kojima, el juego hubiera sido una barbaridad en 2015. Hay muchos fallos y cosas que faltaron en el juego, o mecánicas abandonadas que con tiempo suficiente hubieran solucionado. Por eso el juego fue entregado tan vacío al final. Hubiera sido interesante ver el verdadero potencial que Kojima tenía para Metal Gear Solid V.

Recomiendo el juego a pesar de sus fallos y defectos. No se puede negar que Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain es una obra que marcó a muchos jugadores por su ambición y por lo que representó en la historia de la franquicia. Las reseñas en todo el mundo coinciden en que es un juego con mecánicas innovadoras y un mundo abierto que se siente vivo y orgánico. Sin embargo, también reflejan una gran tristeza y frustración de nosotros varios jugadores porque el juego en su estado final, no alcanzó todo el potencial que prometía.

184351723.review:
I beat the main and all mandatory side missions in 46 hours, and have never beaten a Metal Gear game before. After I got the achievement for beating the final mission, it mentioned that only 17.5% of players had it, meaning only about 1 in 6 people got to the end of the game. I think this proves that, despite the reviews, most people don't actually like the game enough to even complete it's main story. These are the reasons as to why I think this is the case.

The game is very easy, no matter how you choose to play it. Playing stealthily is a breeze due to factors like the enemies' terrible vision. Once, I accidentally started a mission during the day while wearing night camo. I went prone in a mostly flat open area, yet the first enemy to spot me only did so after staring directly at me from about seven meters away. The enemies are also highly predictable. Once you learn their movement patterns, you realise you have plenty of time to make your moves before they even start turning around.

Going in guns blazing is just as simple. You can easily take down dozens of enemies without coming close to death. Even if you get hurt, all you need to do is hide in cover until your health regenerates. Bringing a companion/buddy along makes the game even more trivial. The only thing that might make someone consider it difficult is the reliance on checkpoints instead of manual saves, making it so that a single mistake will see you playing part of the mission all over again, but even this can be cheesed by selling a single material to force a checkpoint.

The gameplay quickly becomes repetitive, not only because of how easy it is but also due to the open-world design. Half of your playtime will literally just involve travelling from one place to another, which is made even more tedious by how barren the world feels. 95% of the map is just wasteland with a few easily avoidable guard posts scattered around, serving only as a way to connect the separate main bases.

The game is also far too long. It took me about 40 hours to beat all of the main and mandatory side missions, though it honestly started to overstay its welcome about 20 hours in.

The last dozen missions are especially tedious. Each one only takes about 5–10 minutes to complete, meaning you can spend just as long travelling there and back as you do playing it. It's a minute in a helicopter to reach a landing zone, then once it drops you off you have to travel for a couple of minutes in order to reach your objective. Once the mission is done, you’ll have to walk all the way back to the landing zone, wait for the helicopter to arrive, and then sit through the ride back out of the map. It’s easily the worst part of the game.

There are also a few annoying quirks. For instance, you can’t climb up or down certain objects while prone, even though it should be possible. Additionally, your character can get stuck on objects like barrels. Despite being cylindrical, they’ll cause you to walk in place until you step backward.

As someone who doesn’t particularly care about the story in most games, I’ll share some quick thoughts without spoiling anything. The story has its ups and downs. The sci-fi elements and technology are among the most interesting and creative concepts I’ve ever seen, and I always enjoyed seeing the robotics the developers came up with. The story also has some genuinely funny moments and has a good moral to it. However, I'd say the moral is near impossible to discern from the story alone, so you’ll likely have to look it up in order to fully understand it.
	
On the downside, the characters are hit or miss. A few of them are well-written, with clear motives and distinct personalities, but the majority have little to no development. Some characters leave you unsure of their goals or reasoning, and a couple could be cut from the story entirely without any meaningful impact, as shown by the fact that you can kill one before recruiting them, and all you lose are a few cutscenes and one mission that doesn't effect anything else.

The story is also rather eccentric and bizarre, which may or may not bother you, depending on your personal taste.

If the game were half as long, I’d recommend it. However, considering how long it takes to beat, I can’t. The map is too empty, the game is too easy, and the missions are too repetitive for me to say otherwise.

184312052.review:
В The Phantom Pain игрок управляет наёмником с позывным «Веном Снейк», иначе известным как Биг Босс, в открытом мире. Игровой процесс достаточно близок к игровому процессу предыдущей игры, Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes: при выполнении заданий игрок должен перемещаться между различными точками игрового мира как можно более скрытно, прятаться от врагов и оставаться незамеченным. Снейк использует на поле боя разнообразное снаряжение, включая бинокли, карты, пистолеты, автоматы и взрывные устройства. В соответствии с традициями серии, The Phantom Pain поощряет игрока на прохождение без убийств и использование против врагов нелетального оружия, такого, как пистолет, стреляющий дротиками с транквилизатором. Игроки могут перемещаться по игровому миру множеством способов: пешком, верхом на лошади, на автомобилях или танках; в некоторых местах карабкаться по скалам. Вооружение и поведение противников меняется в зависимости от деятельности игрока — например, если игрок предпочитает нейтрализовывать врагов выстрелами в голову, многие вражеские солдаты начинают носить каски, а нападения под покровом тьмы приводят к появлению патрульных с приборами ночного видения.

Важной частью игры является развитие главной базы, где Снейк проводит время между миссиями и где разрабатываются новое оружие и способности для Снейка. Для расширения базы игроку необходимы сотрудники, деньги и материалы — игрок добывает их на поле боя, похищая вражеских солдат, технику и разнообразные ценные предметы. «Система Фултона» позволяет скрытно переправлять на базу вражеских солдат и даже диких животных. Похищение противников с особыми способностями открывает для игрока новые возможности — например, если игроку удастся захватить переводчика с русского языка, изначально говорящий только по-английски Снейк сможет понимать переговоры советских солдат и допрашивать пленников
Жаль что стелс умирают в наше время остались только HITMAN  да MG((

184290211.review:
Since most of the reviews on this game are about the main story, I would instead like to write this review on the online portion of the game, specifically Metal Gear Online 3 (MGO 3). MGO 3 is essentially the only multiplayer game that I play, and it keeps bringing me back. There is something so satisfying and fun about it, and its uniqueness repeatedly draws me in. 

One of the striking unique points of MGO 3 is the inclusion of non-lethal options as well as lethal. Taking out foes with non-lethal is (typically) more difficult that simply going for kills with lethal, but it comes with benefits such as being able to rack up points and fulton enemies (which is very important in the Bounty Hunter game mode). Non-lethal requires more skill than lethal, however that makes it all the more satisfying when you are able to pull it off. Furthermore, the option of CQC is something I adore, it is such a rush whenever you are able to perform CQC and do 'true combos' to guarantee a stun on your enemy. It can take a bit of time to learn, but once you master it I find it to be incredibly fun. Some examples include a guaranteed headshot from grab release and placing an explosive mine under a target being fultoned. Other small quirks such as interrogating the opposing team to expose enemy locations and quirky playstyles (like a smoke + NVG non-lethal stealth loadout I have, or magazine stun loadouts) allows for player experimentation and increased enjoyment.

Onto the game modes, only one is consistently played today and that is Bounty Hunter. The great thing about this game mode is that it is a simple death-match but it rewards going non-lethal. Other game modes may be played from time to time, but if you go into any lobby chances are it is going to be Bounty Hunter. The other game modes are Cloak and Dagger (stealth incentivised gameplay), Sabotage (defend or destroy a target), and Comm Control (basic defend/capture territory).

That said, MGO 3 can be quite hard to get into especially nowadays. Its quirks can be unfamiliar to new players and the dwindling playerbase means that although there is usually one lobby in most parts of the day, you will most likely be playing against dedicated and skilled fans with 500-1000 hours (I even saw someone around 7000 hours), so expect to struggle a bit as you learn the ins and outs of the game. The lag in this game can be pretty bad depending on your internet and who is hosting, often leading you to die through walls among other things. It also is not the most balanced game with some weapons being quite hard to deal with (like the grenade launchers). The game is also notorious for cheaters. From personal experience, I seldom encounter very obvious cheaters (such as speedhacks and aimbot) so it is not so much of an issue that the game is unplayable. But allegedly there are an amount of players who use more subtle cheats such as lagswitching. However, this has not been a big enough of an issue for me to not be able to derive any fun from the game.

I often see MGO 3 get compared with its predecessor MGO 2, with individuals claiming that MGO 3 is a downgrade from MGO 2. I have not played MGO 2 myself, but from some of the videos I have seen MGO 2 has better game modes and potentially a better loadout system, but MGO 3 shines when it comes to the fast paced gunplay and the combos which I mentioned earlier.

In short, the uniqueness of the game and satisfying gameplay keeps drawing me back to hop on for yet another match. It can be hard to jump into at first, but if you already have finished the base game, I would suggest giving it a try.

184199204.review:
METAL GEAR SOLID V: THE PHANTOM PAIN — это заключительная часть легендарной серии Metal Gear Solid, созданной гениальным разработчиком Хидэо Кодзимой. Игра предлагает игрокам уникальный опыт, сочетая в себе элементы экшена, стелса и открытого мира, что делает ее одной из самых амбициозных игр своего времени.

 [h1] Сюжет [/h1]

Действие THE PHANTOM PAIN разворачивается в 1984 году, спустя девять лет после событий METAL GEAR SOLID V: GROUND ZEROES. Игрок берет на себя роль Биг Босса (или Нэйкеда Снейка), который пробуждается из комы и пытается восстановить свою армию и репутацию после разрушительного инцидента в GROUND ZEROES. Сюжет игры пронизан темами мести, предательства и моральных дилемм, а также затрагивает сложные политические вопросы, такие как холодная война и ядерное оружие.

 [h1] Геймплей [/h1]

THE PHANTOM PAIN предлагает игрокам обширный открытый мир, который можно исследовать как в одиночку, так и с помощью различных напарников. Игроки могут использовать множество подходов для выполнения миссий: от стелса до прямого столкновения с врагами. Возможность настраивать и улучшать свое снаряжение, а также использовать различные тактики, добавляет глубины в игровой процесс.
Одной из ключевых особенностей игры является система "песочницы", позволяющая игрокам выбирать, как им проходить каждую миссию. Это может включать в себя использование различных транспортных средств, ловушек и даже животных, таких как собака ДД, которая помогает в бою и поиске врагов.

 [h1] Графика и звук [/h1]

Графика в THE PHANTOM PAIN впечатляет, особенно для своего времени. Каждая локация детализирована, а анимации персонажей плавные и реалистичные. Звуковое оформление также на высшем уровне: музыка, созданная композитором Лудовико Эйнауди, прекрасно дополняет атмосферу игры, а озвучка персонажей выполнена с высоким качеством.

 [h1] Темы и философия [/h1]

Как и в предыдущих играх серии, THE PHANTOM PAIN затрагивает множество философских тем, включая природу войны, идентичность и последствия человеческих действий. Игра заставляет игроков задуматься о моральных аспектах своих решений и о том, как они влияют на окружающий мир.

[h1] Заключение [/h1]

METAL GEAR SOLID V: THE PHANTOM PAIN — это не просто игра, а настоящий шедевр, который сочетает в себе глубокий сюжет, захватывающий геймплей и философские размышления. Она оставляет неизгладимый след в сердцах игроков и завершает эпопею о Биг Боссе на высокой ноте. Несмотря на некоторые недостатки, такие как неоднозначное завершение и отсутствие некоторых обещанных элементов, THE PHANTOM PAIN остается одной из лучших игр своего поколения и обязательна к прохождению для всех поклонников жанра.

[h1] You will never play a better open-world stealth game [/h1]

While MGSV:TPP's [strike] unfinished [/strike] story is a classic case of Kojima writing and direction, the [i] crème de la crème [/i] of this flawed masterpiece is the gameplay. With various weapons and tools to use at your disposal, the environments of Afghanistan and the Angola-Zaire border region are your playgrounds. Missions range from Infiltration, extraction, elimination and recon. Gunplay is smooth, satisfying and rewarding whether you choose a sniper from afar or go up close with a grenade launcher. As you progress through the missions, enemy forces adjust to your playstyle forcing you to approach scenarios differently than last time offering endless replay value/

Even after obtaining 100% completion I still return to the game every once in a while to replay missions and check up on my FOBs. The Phantom Pain is an unforgettable experience.

183711917.review:
[i]“Велика війна, велика помста… і багато питань без відповідей.”[/i]

[b]Рецензія на Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain[/b]

[b]Графіка:[/b]

The Phantom Pain виглядає чудово завдяки FOX Engine. Світи Афганістану та Центральної Африки захоплюють деталями — пустелі, скелясті гірські хребти, тропічні джунглі та бази ворогів вражають реалістичністю. Ефекти освітлення та погодні зміни, такі як піщані бурі чи зливи, додають живості ігровому процесу. Анімації персонажів плавні, особливо під час бою чи прихованих переміщень. Однак деякі місцевості відчуваються порожніми, через що відкритий світ виглядає трохи млявим у порівнянні з іншими іграми жанру.

[b]Геймплей:[/b]

Геймплей — це справжній шедевр. Кожна місія пропонує широкий спектр можливостей: стелс, агресивна атака, диверсії або комбінація всього разом. Гравець отримує доступ до величезної кількості інструментів і зброї, які можна налаштовувати залежно від стилю гри. Система напарників, таких як D-Dog, Quiet чи D-Horse, додає стратегічної глибини та можливостей для експериментів.

Проте, попри велику свободу, гра може стати трохи повторюваною. Багато місій відчуваються як варіації одних і тих самих завдань: викрадення, ліквідація, саботаж тощо. Пізніше це може почати трохи набридати, особливо під час виконання другорядних завдань.

[b]Сюжет:[/b]

Як завжди для серії Metal Gear, сюжет — це складна мережа інтриг, зрад, філософських питань та несподіваних поворотів. Історія розповідає про Big Boss і його становлення як легендарного лідера. Проте багатьох гравців розчарував недопрацьований фінал. Відчутно, що гра залишилася незавершеною через внутрішні проблеми між Хідео Кодзімою та Konami.

Самі персонажі, як-от Ocelot, Kaz Miller і Quiet, додають глибини сюжету, але їх розвиток не завжди розкривається повністю. Головна тема помсти передана добре, але багато питань залишається без відповіді, що розчаровує фанатів серії.

[b]Музика:[/b]

Музика — одна з сильних сторін гри. Саундтрек включає як оригінальні композиції, так і ліцензовані пісні 80-х, які додають атмосферності. Наприклад, трек "The Man Who Sold the World" Девіда Бові ідеально підходить до тематики гри. Саундтрек не лише супроводжує події, але й допомагає передати емоційний настрій моментів.

[b]Недоліки:[/b]

Недопрацьований сюжет і незавершеність гри.

Повторюваність завдань, особливо у другій половині гри.

Деякі локації виглядають порожніми та неживими.

Відсутність глибокої інтеракції між персонажами.


[b]Оцінка:[/b]

Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain отримує 8/10. Це гра з винятковим геймплеєм і неймовірною атмосферою, але її незавершеність і повторюваність заважають досягти статусу абсолютного шедевра.

[b]Підсумок:[/b]

The Phantom Pain — це грандіозна гра, яка пропонує багато свободи дій, але не всі її елементи реалізовані повністю. Фанати серії знайдуть тут багато знайомого, але залишаться з почуттям, що історія могла б бути кращою. Це захоплюючий, але трохи гірко-солодкий фінал для спадщини Metal Gear.

En términos de gameplay es impecable, ya sea por el movimiento del personaje y las animaciones, como por la variedad de armas, equipamiento y posibilidades en general. Por otro lado, tanto la historia como las misiones secundarias se basan en hacer las mismas cosas una y otra vez (rescatar un prisionero, matar a alguien, destruir o robar algo) hasta un punto en donde se vuelve demasiado tedioso, sumado a que su "mundo abierto" está absolutamente vacio teniendo que hacer misiones en el mismo lugar mas de una vez.
En resumen, es un muy buen juego de sigilo gracias a su gameplay, pero su sistema de misiones es pésimo y su mapa solo está para hacerte andar kilometros de nada.
